sentences.en: Her appearance at this moment is an omen of disaster.
sentences.cn: 她此时的出现是灾难的预兆。

sentences.en: The people observe thy downcast head, thy clouded mien, and they take it for an omen.
sentences.cn: 人们看到你低垂的头，你闷闷不乐的样子，就以为是不好的预兆。

sentences.en: In a 1-out-of-365 chance, or less considering leap year, Palmisano and Rometty share the same birthday, July 29th; is that an omen of some kind?
sentences.cn: 帕米萨诺和罗梅蒂在7月29日同一天生日，这可是365分之1的小概率，考虑到闰年，可能更小；这是某种预兆吗？
